item.title: AB de Villiers predicts the winner of IPL 2024
item.description: The cricket world is eagerly waiting for the start of the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2024, predictions and speculations are in full swing, former South African batsman and veteran cricketer AB de Villiers, in a recent statement, shared his views on the possible winner of IPL 2024. , which sparked a wave of interest in the cricket community.

item.title: IPL Sponsor Search: BCCI's Wish List & No China Policy
Dhoni will be completely fit before IPL 2024
item.description:
Dhoni will be completely fit before IPL 2024: CSK CEO said - Dhoni will take the retirement decision himself.
CSK CEO Kashi Vishwanathan has given an update regarding the fitness of Mahendra Singh Dhoni. Dhoni said at the launch of Junior Super Kings event in Chennai that Dhoni will be completely fit before IPL2024. Dhoni is rehabbing. He will start practicing in the nets in 10 days.

item.title: IPL 2024: Players Squad List For Each Team Playing IPL 2024
item.description: Australia's best player, Mitchell Starc, became the most expensive in the IPL 2024 auction as KKR bought him INR 24.75 crore.

item.title: IPL 2024 Mega Bids: Pat Cummins Breaks the Bank at 20.5 Cr, Steve Smith Stunned
item.description:
IPL 2024 Mega Bids: Pat Cummins Breaks the Bank at 20.5 Cr, Steve Smith Stunned
Dubai, the pulsating host city for the IPL 2024 Auction, witnessed an electrifying showdown as 332 players vied for the coveted 77 spots across the eight franchises. The auction floor was a melting pot of aspirations, jubilations, and heartbreaks. Pat Cummins emerged as the highest-paid player in IPL history, fetching a staggering 20.5 crores with the Sunrisers Hyderabad.

item.title: IPL-2024 may start in the last week of March
item.description: IPL-2024 may start in the last week of March: Window fixed from 22 March to the end of May; Rehan Ahmed withdrew his name

item.title: Will the barrier of Rs 20 crore be broken in IPL auction: Rachin, Starc and Cummins top players
item.description:
Will the barrier of Rs 20 crore be broken in IPL auction: Rachin, Starc and Cummins top players
The Indian Premier League (IPL) will start in March next year, but the purchase of 10 teams will end on December 19. IPL auction will start at 2:30 pm in Dubai on Tuesday. This time there will be bidding on 333 players, out of which only a maximum of 77 players can be bought. Of these, 30 slots are for foreign players.

item.title: BCCI will auction the title sponsor rights of IPL 2024-28
item.description:
BCCI will auction the title sponsor rights of IPL 2024-28: Tender issued; Tata had the rights for the last 2 seasons
Tata had purchased the rights for the IPL 2022 and 2023 seasons for a total of Rs 600 crore.

item.title: Player’s list of IPL auction 2024 released: 333 players will be auctioned
item.description: Player’s list of IPL auction 2024 released: 333 players will be auctioned, base price of 23 players including Travis Head is Rs 2 crore.

item.title: IPL 2024 mini-auction to be held in Dubai on December 19: 1166 players have registered
item.description:
IPL 2024 mini-auction to be held in Dubai on December 19: 1166 players have registered: Base price of 25 is ₹ 2 crore
The IPL 2024 auction will take place on December 19 in Dubai. This will be the first time that the IPL auction is being held outside the country. IPL administration has given this information on social media. This time, compared to last year, teams will have Rs 5 crore more to buy players.
